page.title: 02The Water Facts.
page.content: The sewage from houses in the area goes to septic tanks in people's gardens. It is treated by being broken down by bacteria.The liquid portion of our sewage drains through the top soil down to Yockleton Brook.Every few years the septic tanks are emptied and taken away by tanker. Our clean water comes from two bore holes, one at Ford and one at Eyton near Alberbury.It is pumped from a huge sandstone aquafer.It is treated with chlorine and an anti - hardness chemical as it is pumped out of the borehole. The groundwater is of high quality and does not really need to be treated. Before mains water was introduced, people had wells.Mr.Poole,of Yew Tree Farm can remember pumping water and carrying it a long way to the house.
